title: Sri Lanka beat Afghanistan to qualify for Asia Cup 2025 Super 4s
byline: Sri Lanka beat Afghanistan by 6 wickets on Thursday, September 18, to qualify for the Super 4s of the ongoing Asia Cup 2025.

title: Israel opens new route out of Gaza City, death toll passes 65,000
byline: The Israeli military said it was opening an additional route for 48 hours that Palestinians could use to leave Gaza City as it stepped up efforts on Wednesday to empty the city of civilians and confront thousands of Hamas combatants.

title: Stalemate between Govt and electricity trade unions continues
byline: Electricity trade unions have warned that they will further intensify their ongoing trade union actions if their demands continue to be ignored.

title: Restrictions imposed on entry to BIA Departure Lobby amended
byline: Restrictions imposed to enter the Departure Lobby of the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) have been amended.

title: Kandy Dalada Maligawa Diyawadana Nilame election date announced
byline: The election for the Diyawadana Nilame of the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy is scheduled to take place on or around November 7, the Commissioner General of Buddhist Affairs, Gamini Senarathna has stated.

title: One lane opposite CEB head office closed due to protest
byline: One lane on the road from Slave Island to Lake House roundabout has been closed due to a protest staged by CEB employees opposite of the CEB head office, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Wife of ‘Backhoe Saman’ further remanded
byline: The wife of underworld figure ‘Backhoe Saman’, Shadhika Lakshani has been further remanded until September 25 by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Sri Lanka’s overseas missions directed to identify new export markets, attract sustainable foreign investments
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Vijitha Herath, along with the Minister of Industry, Sunil Handunneththi, and Minister of Trade, Wasantha Samarasinghe, launched an integrated mechanism to enhance collaboration between Sri Lanka’s overseas Missions and national institutions.

title: Body found in canal in Tissamaharama – Friend arrested over suspected murder
byline: A body of a male has been discovered in a canal located in the Sandungama, within the Tissamaharama Police Division.

title: 3.9 magnitude earthquake strikes off Trincomalee coast
byline: An earthquake of 3.9 magnitude was recorded on Thursday (18) in the sea area off the coast of Trincomalee, according to the Geological Survey and Mines Bureau of Sri Lanka (GSMB).

title: Former NLB Director Thusitha Halloluwa granted bail
byline: Former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board, Thusitha Halloluwa has been granted bail after being produced before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Bangladesh bars ex-PM Sheikh Hasina, family from voting in next year’s election
byline: Bangladesh’s Election Commission (EC) on Wednesday said it has “locked” the national identity cards of deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina, effectively barring her from voting in the general elections scheduled for February next year.

title: Transport Minister warns underperforming railway officials: ‘Fix it or resign’
byline: Minister of Transport Bimal Rathnayake has issued a stern warning to officials attached to the Railway Department, stating that those who fail to ensure the proper functioning and maintenance of railway services should be prepared to step down.

title: Dambulla Waste Management Facility no longer operational
byline: The Dambulla Waste Management Facility, an award-winning waste management project in the country initiated with an investment of around Rs. 650 million, has reportedly become completely inactive.

title: Public consultation on proposed electricity tariff revision to begin today
byline: Public consultation sessions on the proposed electricity tariff revision will commence today (18).

title: Women MPs’ Caucus discusses pathways toward a gender-sensitive Parliament
byline: Sri Lanka’s Women Parliamentarians’ Caucus discussed Potential pathways for UK support to the Caucus with representatives of the Westminster Foundation for Democracy (WFD)...

title: Five people at risk of dying daily due to chronic kidney disease in Sri Lanka
byline: Approximately five individuals in Sri Lanka are at risk of dying daily due to chronic kidney disease, the National Unit for Kidney Disease Prevention and Research states.

title: ‘Disrupt Asia 2025’ aims to unlock Sri Lanka as South Asia’s innovation hub
byline: The second day of Disrupt Asia 2025, Sri Lanka’s premier startup conference and innovation festival running from September 17–20, unfolded today at Cinnamon Life with the main conference, drawing international attention and underscoring the country’s ambition to position itself as South Asia’s emerging innovation hub.

title: Jimmy Kimmel taken off air over Charlie Kirk comments
byline: ABC has pulled late-night host Jimmy Kimmel off air indefinitely over comments he made about the shooting of right-wing influencer Charlie Kirk.

title: Former S’gamuwa Minister remanded over misappropriation of state funds
byline: Former Minister of the Sabaragamuwa Provincial Council Athula Kumara Rahubaddha has been remanded until October 02 by the Embilipitiya Magistrate’s Court today (18), Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Meta launches smart glasses with built-in display, reaching for ‘superintelligence’
byline: Meta Platforms on Wednesday launched its first consumer-ready smart glasses with a built-in display, seeking to extend the momentum of its Ray-Ban line, one of the early consumer hits of the artificial intelligence era.

title: Shop at Dambulla market destroyed in fire
byline: A fire broke out in a shop within the Dambulla weekly market belonging to the Dambulla Municipal Council early this morning (18).

title: UK regulator proposes exempting crypto firms from ‘integrity’ and other rules
byline: Crypto firms in Britain could be exempted from rules that ensure financial services companies act with integrity and in the interests of customers, under new proposals outlined by the Financial Conduct Authority on Wednesday.

title: Cambodian PM accuses Thai forces of evicting civilians on border
byline: Cambodia’s leader Hun Manet has accused Thailand of preventing more than 20 families from returning to their homes on the disputed border, according to his letter to the head of the UN released on Thursday (Sep 18).

title: Air India crash victims’ families sue aerospace firms Boeing and Honeywell
byline: The families of four passengers who died on an Air India jet that crashed in June have filed a lawsuit in the US against planemaker Boeing and aircraft parts maker Honeywell, accusing the companies of negligence.

title: Businessman arrested for selling foreign cigarettes to schoolchildren
byline: A businessman has been arrested by the police on suspicion of selling illegally imported cigarettes to schoolchildren in the Thanamalwila area.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, Northern and North-western provinces and in Galle and Matara districts today (19), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Sri Lankan cricketer Dunith Wellalage’s father passes away
byline: Suranga Wellalage, the father of Sri Lankan national team cricketer Dunith Wellalage, has passed away at the age of 54.

title: Strong quake off Russia Far East, tsunami alert lifted
byline: A powerful 7.8-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of Russia’s far eastern Kamchatka peninsula early Friday (Sep 19), rocking buildings and prompting authorities to issue a tsunami alert, later lifted.

title: US again vetoes UN Security Council Gaza ceasefire call
byline: The United States on Thursday (Sep 18) again wielded its veto and thwarted a UN Security Council call for a ceasefire in Gaza, shielding its ally Israel from meaningful diplomatic pressure.

title: Global cricket stars express condolences over death of Dunith Wellalage’s father
byline: The global cricketing fraternity has expressed profound sorrow over the sudden demise of Suranga Wellalage, the father of young Sri Lankan all-rounder Dunith Wellalage, who was representing his country in the Asia Cup cricket tournament.

title: 2026 Budget to lay foundation for country’s development – Dy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Economic Development Dr. Anil Jayantha Fernando has stated that the upcoming national budget will lay the foundation for the country’s development.

title: 26-year-old youth dies after falling from bus in Kilinochchi
byline: A tragic accident was reported in Kilinochchi last night (18), when a passenger died after falling from a bus traveling from Ariviyal Nagar towards Uruthirapuram, at the 8th Ela area on the Uruthtipuram Road within the Kilinochchi Police Division.

title: Indian actor-comedian Robo Shankar, known for Tamil film roles, dies aged 46
byline: Indian comedian Robo Shankar died on Thursday (Sep 18), days after being admitted into the critical care unit. He was 46.

title: Woman dies after consuming poison, three children hospitalised
byline: A 32-year-old woman from the Hapudandawala area of Dambagahapitiya, Ududumbara, has died after reportedly feeding her three children poison and then consuming poison herself, police confirmed.

title: 6.1-magnitude quake hits Indonesia’s Central Papua: USGS
byline: A shallow earthquake of magnitude 6.1 struck Indonesia’s Central Papua province on Friday (Sep 19), the US Geological Survey (USGS) reported, with no initial reports of casualties.

title: Dunith Wellalage returns to Sri Lanka after father’s passing
byline: Sri Lankan all-rounder Dunith Wellalage has returned to the island this morning (19) following the sudden passing of his father, Suranga Wellalage.

title: Reorganization of SLFP commences in Badulla District
byline: The reorganization of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) has been commenced in the Badulla District today (19) under the patronage of Badulla District Member of Parliament Chamara Sampath Dassanayake.

title: ‘Ali Roshan’ sentenced to 15 years RI for illegal possession of elephant
byline: Samarappulige Niraj Roshan, alias ‘Ali Roshan’, who was convicted on two counts of possessing an elephant without a valid permit, has been sentenced to 15 years of rigorous imprisonment by a three-judge bench of the Colombo High Court.

title: Shasheendra Rajapaksa further remanded
byline: Former State Minister Shasheendra Rajapaksa, who faces allegations of offenses under the Public Property Act, has been further remanded until September 22 by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: Army Lance Corporal honored for saving lives in deadly Ella bus crash
byline: A special ceremony was held in Wellawaya to honor Lance Corporal W. M. V. M. Bandara of the Sri Lanka Army Special Forces for his courageous actions during the recent fatal bus accident on the Ella–Wellawaya main road.

title: Gunman and two suspects arrested in murder of Dan Priyasad
byline: The alleged shooter in the murder of political activist Dan Priyasad was arrested last night, along with two others—including a woman—in Ranwala town, Kegalle, the police confirmed.

title: Over 700 individuals arrested during special island-wide police raids
byline: Sri Lanka Police announced that a total of 736 suspects were arrested yesterday (18) during island-wide operations conducted to prevent crime and curb drug-related activities.

title: Landslide warnings issued for several areas in five districts
byline: Early landslide warnings have been issued for multiple areas in five districts as heavy rainfall continues in parts of the island.

title: Deputy Foreign Ministers of Sri Lanka & Ukraine hold phone call on boosting bilateral ties
byline: Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment of Sri Lanka, Arun Hemachandra, held a cordial telephone conversation yesterday (18) with Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine and Head of the Ukrainian National Commission for UNESCO, Mariana Betsa.

title: Appeals Court orders Jaffna MC to take measures against air pollution
byline: The Court of Appeal today ordered the Jaffna Municipal Council to take all necessary steps to reduce air pollution in the Jaffna area.

title: SLAF intelligence officer arrested over Rs. 20M gold smuggling attempt at BIA
byline: In a major enforcement success, the Narcotics Control Unit of Sri Lanka Customs apprehended an intelligence officer of the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), for allegedly attempting to smuggle gold worth Rs. 20 million into the country.

title: ASPI closes at new all-time high
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed at a new all-time high after making significant gains today.

title: Police submit investigation report on ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’ to court
byline: The police submitted an investigation report today (19) to the Colombo Magistrate’s Court, regarding notorious organised criminal Mandinu Padmasiri Perera, alias ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’, who was recently arrested in Indonesia, brought back to Sri Lanka, and is currently in the custody of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Lands in Northern Province will not be released for political gains – Minister Bimal
byline: Minister Bimal Ratnayake stated that lands in the Northern Province acquired by the government for security purposes will not be released with the aim of gaining political advantages.

title: Petition seeking protection for ‘Panadura Nilanga’ fixed for consideration
byline: The Court of Appeal has ordered that a writ petition filed seeking directives to ensure the safety of alleged underworld figure Nilanga Sampath Silva, alias ‘Panadura Nilanga’, be taken up for consideration on September 26.

title: Trump hopes to settle TikTok’s fate on Xi call
byline: President Donald Trump, who recently accused Xi Jinping of working to “conspire” against the United States, hopes to finalise the fate of video-sharing app TikTok and make progress on trade talks in a phone call with the Chinese leader on Friday (Sep 19).
